instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message:
Hi, I have a MacBook air 13" that does not chime does not display any picture but the fan runs 100% the firmware reset function works as well when I press cmd+option+p+r it resets but no chime, I bought a new efi chip on ebay and it displays the same symptom. Can anyone share any advice on what it might be?

thanks,

- Mike

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message:
How do you know PRAM reset is working? Put back original chip, those Ebay ones are probably a dump from another board and will give ME region problems.
Connect a USB mouse and see if it lights up.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: I truly appreciate your response, I took the bottom cover off and press cmd+option+p+r and I noticed the fan turn off and on what it does when there is no chime. I put back the original chip and it does the same thing. It seems like the ebay chip has done something to the logicboard. The chime was present when i had the original efi chip in there once I put the ebay efi chip it displayed the no chime black screen issue. The mouse lights on then turns off every 10 seconds.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message:
What do you think the issues is?/////

thank you,

-Mike

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: So is there a chime now with the original chip back?

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: Good evening, there is no chime with the original efi chip back in the logicboard. I left solder flux on the logicboard, do you think that might've shorted something?

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message:
You said "The chime was present when i had the original efi chip in there"
So what happened, was there a chime at some point? Flux does not short out anything unless it is the fake garbage from China.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: Yes the chime was present when i had the original efi chip in there.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: The flux I used is top quality from MG Chemicals

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: Well, then it should still chime once you put it back. Something got messed up, inspect all resistors near <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, maybe missing or moved.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Macbook Air 13" early 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime No display fan runs
threads.message: thank you for all of your help, I figured out the issue, it was the efi it was stuck in some hang up mode I used a jtag programmer to kick it out of this weird state. How do I mark this as solved?
